usefulItems: cling wrap, round baking dish (10 in.), wire rack, refrigerator, oven
title: Cherry Clafoutis (Ludo Lefebvre)

ingredients.content: 2 oz unsalted butter, melted, plus extra to grease
3 ½ oz all-purpose flour, plus extra to dust
8 oz fresh cherries, pitted, de-stemmed (approx. 26 cherries)

preparations.content: Place butter into mixing bowl and melt <b>2 min/160°F/speed 1.5<b>.

Add milk, eggs, egg yolks, sugar, Kirsch, vanilla, salt and flour and mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours (see Tip).
Preheat oven to 400°F. Generously grease bottom and sides of a round baking dish (10 in.), dust with flour and tap out excess.

Pour batter into baking dish and place cherries into batter. The tops of the cherries should remain exposed after batter is added. Bake on center rack, 45-50 minutes (400°F) until puffed, lightly golden and center is set. Allow to cool on a wire rack.
Dust with confectioners sugar and serve warm or at room temperature.

hintsAndTricks: Batter can be made up to 2 days ahead and refrigerated.
To replace fresh cherries with frozen: thaw, drain juices and proceed with recipe.
Replace fresh cherries with pears, cored, sliced and diced (½ in.).
